content.raw:
Elena (elen4 on GitHub) built upon the fantastic SimbodyConfig.cmake that you guys wrote for us and has made Simbody re-locatable (at least as far as CMake is concerned). So, the installed SimbodyConfig.cmake does not contain any hardcoded paths. Here is Elena's pull request that achieved this: https://github.com/simbody/simbody/pull/356

I have also done the same relocatability for OpenSim: https://github.com/opensim-org/opensim-core/commit/80c74f140bf382fc77c57e395fe3193e032336b6

The end of this page (http://www.cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/module/CMakePackageConfigHelpers.html) explains what to do.

The only *real* reason that it was necessary to do this was that, on Windows, the OpenSim installer lets the user choose their installation directory, and so we don't know the installation directory at build time. 

So if what you are looking for is a way to use CMake Config files to make your binary package relocatable, then this is exactly what you're looking for.  However, I don't know how configure.bat relates to CMake Config files.

Can you tell me what configure.bat does, where it comes from or what/who generates it?
